definition: one's whole heart/from the bottom of one's heart

sentences.english: So let us seize it, not in fear,but in gladness.
sentences.chinese: 因此，讓我們毫無畏懼，滿心愉悅地把握命運。

sentences.english: Not a trace of weariness, only happy.
sentences.chinese: 沒有一絲倦意，只有滿心歡喜。

sentences.english: I fully expected one of the women to volunteer6, as was usually the case.
sentences.chinese: 我滿心指望像平常一樣，某位女士能毛遂自薦。

sentences.english: So, when it comes to a film about Spider-Man, I have certain expectations.
sentences.chinese: 因此，每一部有關蜘蛛俠的電影，我都會滿心期待。

sentences.english: Since this was my first time to take the plane, I was filled with joy.
sentences.chinese: 因爲這是我第一次坐飛機，所以我滿心歡喜。

sentences.english: God uses faith-filled people to do his work.
sentences.chinese: 神使用滿心相信的人爲祂作工。

sentences.english: In fact, it is full of the mood to do, just fall.
sentences.chinese: 其實，這是滿心情願的事情，只是心有餘而力不足。

sentences.english: Into a spacious "home" high - wai whole heart happy.
sentences.chinese: 搬進了寬敞的“新家”，高煒滿心歡喜。

sentences.english: The flattening of underwear with pleasure is the job of the chambermaid.
sentences.chinese: 女服務員的工作就是滿心歡喜地將內衣褲壓平。

sentences.english: I choke with sobs ah full of sorrow, lament that they are like to crash.
sentences.chinese: 我泣不成聲啊滿心悲傷，哀嘆自己是這樣生不逢辰。

sentences.english: You have exalted the right hand of his foes, have gladdened all his enemies.
sentences.chinese: 你高舉了他仇人的右手，使他的敵人都滿心歡愉。

sentences.english: At 11, I read the novel with great delight.
sentences.chinese: 十一歲時，我滿心歡喜地閱讀這本小說。

sentences.english: There a re festive candles, but this is a time when people do not celebrate with joy.
sentences.chinese: 點上節日蠟燭，但並非人們都在慶祝新年時滿心歡喜。

sentences.english: Shu-yun wang filled with reluctant but also dare not attack.
sentences.chinese: 王淑雲滿心不情願卻也不敢發作。

definition: to be amazed/to be surprised/to wonder
to be eager to give sth a try (idiom)
to worry about/to be concerned about
to miss/to long for/to remember with longing/yearning
bored to death (idiom)/bored stiff/overcome with boredom
